claims.claim: Neel Nanda is the Mechanistic Interpretability lead at DeepMind

source.context: Mech interp monitoring sources list for Joe

sources.excerpt: I run the Google DeepMind mechanistic interpretability team
Mechanistic Interpretability Team Lead, Google DeepMind

verification.explanation: Confirmed via Neel Nanda's personal site and Google Scholar. Title is 'Google DeepMind' (post-merger name).

claims.claim: Telegram Bot API supports receiving 'user is typing' status updates

source.context: Discussion with Dean about typing indicators

sources.excerpt: Bot API update types include messages, edited_message, channel_post, etc. - no typing updates
Inline queries can be used as workaround since they send user text in real-time

verification.explanation: INCORRECT. The full MTProto API has updateChatUserTyping, but the Bot API does NOT support receiving typing indicators. Bots can SEND typing status but cannot RECEIVE it.

claims.claim: Washington Post laid off 30% of staff (~300 journalists) and CEO Will Lewis stepped down

sources.excerpt: Will Lewis has abruptly stepped down, just days after the newspaper laid off one-third of its staff, including at least 300 journalists
Departure comes days after newspaper laid off nearly one-third of staff, including more than 300 journalists
laying off one-third of its staff

verification.explanation: Confirmed by CNN, Guardian, AP News, NPR. All major outlets agree on ~30% / one-third layoffs including 300+ journalists, and Lewis resignation.

claims.claim: Desmond Hume spent 3 years alone in the Swan Station pushing the button

source.context: Blog post about The Hatch (watchdog) and Lost references

sources.excerpt: Desmond spent three years in the Swan station until he discovered his partner Kelvin was secretly planning to escape
Kelvin claimed the island was contaminated and forced Desmond to stay within the confines of the Swan Station for three years

verification.explanation: Confirmed by Lostpedia (the canonical Lost wiki) and IGN. Desmond was trapped in the Swan Station for three years by Kelvin.

claims.claim: Claude Max subscription costs $200/month flat rate

source.context: Discussion about Max subscription cost savings

sources.excerpt: Max: From $100 Per person billed monthly. Choose 5x or 20x more usage than Pro

verification.explanation: PARTIALLY INCORRECT. Claude Max starts at $100/month (5x tier), not $200. The $200 figure might refer to Pro annual billing ($200 upfront) or a higher Max tier (20x). Current pricing shows Max 'From $100' per person.

source.context: Discussion about Opus 4.6 features and upgrade decision

sources.excerpt: Anthropic released Opus 4.6 on February 5, 2026.
Opus 4.6 was announced today, February 5, 2026.
Claude Opus 4.6 was released by Anthropic on February 5, 2026

verification.explanation: Confirmed by Wikipedia, Medium, Reddit, and Anthropic's release notes. Multiple independent sources agree on the February 5, 2026 release date.

claims.claim: Claude Pro subscription costs $20/month ($17/month with annual billing)

sources.excerpt: Pro at $20/month or effectively $17/month when billed annually
Most individual professionals find Claude Pro at $20/month the sweet spot
Pro (from $17/month annually)

verification.explanation: Confirmed by multiple pricing guides. Claude Pro is $20/month or ~$17/month effective when billed annually ($204/year).

claims.claim: Reticulum has one main dev (markqvist) carrying 95% of 47K+ lines of code

source.context: Discussion with Dean about mesh networking protocols

sources.excerpt: markqvist has 2135 of 2257 total commits (94%)
Top contributor: markqvist with 2135 commits; next closest is 23 commits

verification.explanation: Verified via GitHub API. Reticulum repo has 47,036 lines of Python code. markqvist has 94% of all commits (2135/2257), essentially matching the '95%' claim. The dominance is even more stark: the next highest contributor has only 23 commits.

claims.claim: WordPress powers 42.6% of all websites globally

source.context: Morning News Digest - WordPress AI assistant coverage

sources.excerpt: Around 43% of all websites use WordPress, making it by far the most widely-used platform
WordPress powers more than 40% of all websites on the internet
As a CMS, WordPress holds a dominant 65% market share

verification.explanation: Verified. Multiple sources confirm WordPress powers 40-43% of all websites. The 42.6% figure falls within this range. Among CMS-powered sites specifically, WordPress holds 61-65% market share.

claims.claim: WIRED published article 'I Loved My OpenClaw Agent—Until It Turned on Me' by Will Knight on Feb 11, 2026, documenting a 'guacamole incident'

sources.excerpt: Will Knight, Business, Feb 11, 2026 2:00 PM... This is one of several things I discovered while using the viral artificial intelligence bot... look no further than this weekend's guacamole incident... Molty became oddly determined to dispatch a single serving of guacamole

verification.explanation: Fully verified via direct web fetch of WIRED article. Author: Will Knight. Date: Feb 11, 2026 2:00 PM. The guacamole incident is described in detail - the agent repeatedly tried to order guacamole despite being told not to.

claims.claim: Supply chain attack on Cline CLI 2.3.0 installed OpenClaw on developer systems on February 17, 2026

sources.excerpt: On February 17, 2026, at 3:26 AM PT, an unauthorized party used a compromised npm publish token to publish an update to Cline CLI on the NPM registry: cline@2.3.0

Someone compromised open source AI coding assistant Cline CLI's npm package earlier this week in an odd supply chain attack that secretly installed OpenClaw on developers' machines without their knowledge
The malicious version of Cline's npm package — 2.3.0 — was downloaded more than 4,000 times before it was removed

verification.explanation: Confirmed by The Hacker News, The Register, Dark Reading, Endor Labs, and Snyk. Attack occurred Feb 17, 2026 at 3:26 AM PT via compromised npm token. Downloaded 4,000+ times before removal.

claims.claim: DeepMind published Nature paper 'A roadmap for evaluating moral competence in large language models'

source.context: Morning News Digest - Mech Interp section

sources.excerpt: A roadmap for evaluating moral competence in large language models. Nature 650, 565–573 (2026)
What Haas, Isaac, and their colleagues at Google DeepMind propose is a new line of research to develop more rigorous techniques for evaluating moral competence in LLMs

verification.explanation: Verified via Nature journal directly (s41586-025-10021-1) and MIT Technology Review coverage. Authors include William Isaac and Julia Haas from Google DeepMind.

claims.claim: SecureClaw released by Adversa AI as first OWASP-aligned security plugin/skill for OpenClaw

sources.excerpt: SecureClaw provides automated auditing, configuration hardening, and runtime protection
SecureClaw is structured as two components: a plugin and a skill
Protect OpenClaw agents with SecureClaw by Adversa AI. An open-source suite covering OWASP Top 10 risks via 50+ audit checks

verification.explanation: Verified via PR Newswire, Help Net Security, Security Week, and Adversa AI blog. Open-source dual-stack (plugin + skill) solution with 50+ audit checks aligned to OWASP Agentic Security Initiative.

claims.claim: 'We Are Legion (We Are Bob)' is the first book in the Bobiverse series by Dennis E. Taylor

sources.excerpt: The book that launched a thousand Bobs and the first novel in the Bobiverse series from Dennis E. Taylor
We Are Legion (We Are Bob) (Bobiverse, #1) by Dennis E. Taylor

verification.explanation: Verified via Amazon and Goodreads. The book title is the origin of the domain name wearebob.blog - referencing the AI replication theme.
